text:
Gertrude Boyle (née Lamfrom; March 6, 1924 – November 3, 2019) was a German-born American businesswoman. Her father started Columbia Sportswear, where she later became president. Ahe was the chairperson of the company, as well as a philanthropist and memoirist.
Boyle died on November 3, 2019 at her home in Portland, Oregon, at the age of 95.
